page.title: 07Local Employment
page.content: Agriculture is the biggest employer here although quite a lot of people work at the distillery. Three teachers are employed at the local school and eight other teachers visit the school during the year. Four other people are employed part-time at the school. Other jobs in the area are provided by the Post Office, the shop, the pub, the garage (which employs mini-bus drivers as well as a mechanic) the church and at Leith Hall where guides as well as gardeners are employed. Many people live in and around Kennethmont but travel elsewhere to work, mainly to Insch or Huntly but some travel to Inverurie, Turriff or Aberdeen. Other people who have their homes here are away for longer periods as they work offshore on the North Sea oil-rigs.
